project.teaser: The TRANSEATION main objective is to demonstrate the effectiveness of marine and coastal hybrid blue-grey infrastructures and validate a new level of ecosystem-based management combining nature-based solutions, social implication digitalization to the protection and...
project.objective: The TRANSEATION main objective is to demonstrate the effectiveness of marine and coastal hybrid blue-grey infrastructures and validate a new level of ecosystem-based management combining nature-based solutions, social implication digitalization to the protection and restoration of marine ecosystem health and services. To ensure the success of this main objective, the TRANSEATION project counts on partners and collaborators with broad expertise in relevant areas covering four types of entities in the project (from research and technological centers to companies and offshore industrial operators) as follows: managerial (CMCC, IOW, GLP, CTN), industrial (SAITEC, ITASKORDA, GEOCORAIL, CCELL), scientifical (OE, UOH, CMCC, AZTI, GAIKER, IOW, DTU, CTN) and participatory (SO, ECOOCEAN, AZTI, CTN, CMCC). In addition, this project implements three user cases towards marine and coastal infrastructures, considering the different life cycle stages. Then, the following 5 specific objectives are identified: Specific objective 1. Apply EBM through a systema approach to integrate hybrid NbS in marine and coastal infrastructures to support the preservation and restoration of marine biodiversity and ecosystem services simultaneously with addressing multiple societal challenges (environmental, social and economic benefits). Specific objective 2. Demonstrate the effectiveness of [3] type of coastal and marine infrastructures as hybrid NbS both to preserve ecosystems and support their restoration considering its replicability and scaled-up. Specific objective 3. To identify limiting factors, gaps and current issues of existing LEED initiative regarding “blue building”, setting up links with previous projects. Specific objective 4. To analyze the benefits and potential trade-off of these hybrid solutions in short and long-term for marine biodiversity and ecosystem services protection and restoration. Specific objective 5. Digital solutions for monitoring, analysis and social involvement
project.title: Advancing Ecosystem-Based Management through Hybrid Blue-Grey Infrastructures in Marine and Coastal Areas

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: "The ""Data Management Plan"" deliverable outlines the strategy and procedures for the management of data throughout the course of the project. It aims to ensure that data is collected, processed, stored, and shared in a systematic and secure manner, adhering to best practices and legal requirements."

result.title: Support material for participatory activities
result.description: "The ""Support Material for Participatory Activities"" deliverable is a comprehensive report that provides the necessary materials and resources to facilitate participatory activities with stakeholders in a specific project or initiative. The report aims to enhance stakeholder engagement and collaboration by offering various tools and materials that enable meaningful contributions and interactions during workshops, meetings, and other participatory events."

result.title: Data Sharing Platform
result.description: "The ""Data Sharing Platform"" deliverable is a comprehensive report detailing the development and implementation of a platform designed to facilitate the sharing of data among relevant stakeholders within a specific project or system."

result.title: Report on baseline monitoring in project demos
result.description: "The ""Report on Baseline Monitoring in Project demos"" is a document that presents the findings and results of the baseline monitoring conducted in the context of project demos."

result.title: Policy Brief European level
result.description: Summarizes the issue and challenges addressed in the project and provides evidence-based recommendations for policymakers.

result.title: 1st Communication and dissemination activities reports
result.description: "The ""Communication and Dissemination Activities Reports"" deliverable consists of a series of reports that provide an account of the communication and dissemination activities conducted during the project."

result.title: Criteria and guidelines for systemic risk assessment in project demonstrators
result.description: "The ""Criteria and Guidelines for Systemic Risk Assessment in Project Demonstrators"" is a document that outlines the criteria and guidelines to be used for assessing systemic risk in project demonstrators."

result.title: Roadmap for stakeholder engagement
result.description: "The ""Roadmap for Stakeholder Engagement"" deliverable is a detailed report that outlines the strategies, activities, and timelines for engaging stakeholders throughout a specific project or initiative. The roadmap aims to provide a clear plan for building and maintaining effective relationships with various stakeholders to ensure their active participation and support in the project's success."

result.title: Dissemination, Communication and Stakeholder Engagement Plan
result.description: "The ""Dissemination, Communication, and Stakeholder Engagement Plan"" deliverable outlines a comprehensive strategy for effectively disseminating project information, communicating project findings, and engaging with relevant stakeholders."

result.title: 1 st Updated version of the DMP
result.description: "The ""1st Updated Version of the Data Management Plan"" deliverable is a revised and improved version of the initial Data Management Plan. This updated document incorporates feedback and lessons learned from the project's early stages and ensures that the data management processes align with the evolving project needs."

result.title: Short report on strength and weaknesses of re-analysis case studies
result.description: "The ""Short Report on Strengths and Weaknesses of Re-analysis Case Studies"" is a document that evaluates and assesses the advantages and limitations of using re-analysis case studies in a specific context or research project."

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
